## IOpenSearchDashboardsSocket interface

A tiny abstraction for TCP socket.

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface IOpenSearchDashboardsSocket 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [authorizationError?](./opensearch-dashboards.iopensearchdashboardssocket.authorizationerror.md) | Error | <i>(Optional)</i> The reason why the peer's certificate has not been verified. This property becomes available only when <code>authorized</code> is <code>false</code>. |
|  [authorized?](./opensearch-dashboards.iopensearchdashboardssocket.authorized.md) | boolean | <i>(Optional)</i> Indicates whether or not the peer certificate was signed by one of the specified CAs. When TLS isn't used the value is <code>undefined</code>. |

## Methods

|  Method | Description |
|  --- | --- |
|  [getPeerCertificate(detailed)](./opensearch-dashboards.iopensearchdashboardssocket.getpeercertificate.md) |  |
|  [getPeerCertificate(detailed)](./opensearch-dashboards.iopensearchdashboardssocket.getpeercertificate_1.md) |  |
|  [getPeerCertificate(detailed)](./opensearch-dashboards.iopensearchdashboardssocket.getpeercertificate_2.md) | Returns an object representing the peer's certificate. The returned object has some properties corresponding to the field of the certificate. If detailed argument is true the full chain with issuer property will be returned, if false only the top certificate without issuer property. If the peer does not provide a certificate, it returns null. |
